intro: Brachystelma floribundum var. mlimakito, commonly known as the Mlimakito starling cactus, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching structure with small, fleshy stems. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
